Little morsels of nuggets made from harvesting beetles.
Little morsels of nuggets made from harvesting Bombardier Beetles.
They may look like gross insect larva, but really, they're gross insect larva that's also a good source of protein.
A packet of fruit for your A-OK Bloomer Vertical Garden.
A packet of herbs for your A-OK Bloomer Vertical Garden.
A packet of flowers for your A-OK Bloomer Vertical Garden.

This striking cabinet was found at a yard sale by a furniture historian who noticed something quite unusual about it. Further testing confirmed it had been carved from petrified wood! Little is known about the maker, but the wood dates back to 67 Million years ago when dinosaurs roamed the earth. Of course, the technology used to determine such dates sometimes shorts out, so it's possible that it is only 6,700 years old when pottery was the latest thing, or 670 when knitting was first invented, but hey. That's still pretty old!

Tripping over a massive laundry mountain each morning used to be a way of life, but it doesn't have to be. With this sleek laundry organizer, your towels, robes, unmentionables and everything in between can be lovingly draped, carefully socked away or stored as haphazardly as you please: off the floor! So if you're done with yodeling up a mountain of socks and wondering when the next underpants avalanche will be, pick one up today.
Better Than the Floor Laundry Hutch

Eventually every Lock Up must come down. But the counties loss is your gain because now you can reform your home décor with lovely shelf dividers by Second Chance Shelves. They’re thug crafted from gently used prison cell bars & rehabilitated barfateria table wood - And heavy duty? Let’s just say you can throw the book at them 'cause these shelves are doing life without parole. All this at a price that won’t leave you feeling shanked.
Second Chance Shelves – by Hoosegow Direct

Organizing is tough. No one should have to do it alone, or be judged by the amount of clutter you've accumulated over the years. We get it, and we have the perfect cabinet for you to store, well... whatever you want! Old flower pots? No problem. Tiny ladder that you thought would be way bigger when you ordered it? Check! Basket of leaves? Bring it on! Surplus of old hand-written fan-fiction romance novels? We've got built in doors for you to hide your shame. If you've got it, we've got a place for it in this cabinet. No questions asked.

What happens to old rowboats? The lucky ones are reclaimed and turned into sleek shelves like this one! So when you look at your shelf, don't just see a shelf. See a day at the lake, a peaceful river, or a duck pond of cuteness. Or, if your imagination needs some work, you can see a shelf too. That's okay. No one will paddle you.

2 shelves walked into a bar. After hitting it off with the second shelf, the first shelf decided to ask them on a date. "Hey, would you maybe..want to hang out sometime?" the first shelf nervously asked. The second shelf enthusiastically agreed, but took things a little too literally. The rest is history, my friends. That is how The Hanging Shelf was born!

Perfectly measured for your wall space, any wall space that will for it anyway! This shelf is perfect for those who like to keep things tidy, within the same space, but with a hint of interest. Every shelf has a purpose, every size is perfectly calculated to host your wares.\n\nNote: This wall shelf comes preassembled, so that Sims are not feeling like they are playing Blicblock while trying to install this beautiful piece. We recommend not separating into individual pieces.
A favourite among children, this fun shelf design brings life to any room regardless of age. Perfectly measured slots will give your wares a home while looking like it is made out of a game.

The look of strength personified in a sink. This sink not only looks like it has seen and been through a lot, but it also looks like it is handling it with ease and grace. Features space for placing perfectly folded towels, even a space for your garden hose. But who says this cannot give your home a rugged look by placing it indoors? Perfect for a low maintenance guest bathroom and messy Sims.

Prove to everyone that you really did wash your hands before returning to work by using the Semi-Private WashUp. Any germaphobe or Health Department agent can clearly see for themselves through the hefty hunk of repurposed, translucent Simsunite TM that you totally sudsed up every nook and cranny of those dirty digits. Proudly manufactured in Washkansin.

In its previous life, this chair hosted multiple Sims and even played Musical Chairs. However, as the years went by with multiple lots and owners, it ended up in the neighborhood dumpster. But never fear! You now have given it a new life by rescuing it from the clutches of the stanknation and it can currently become a chic staple in your lot.

Eco-friendly doesn't necessarily mean 100% recycled. This hand-carved chair was whittled down from a solid piece of fallen wood, using no wasteful glue, screws, nails or fastening materials. The sustainability of these chairs is also the perfect conversation starter during those awkward, silent dinners between you and your significant other when you're questioning your relationship and wondering where the magic has gone. 100% oak!
Comfy, practical and way cheaper than the leading brands, this dining chair will give your family the perfect place to bunker down for a family meal.
Sometimes you have to take things into your own hands… or nozzles. Created to your own preferences, this chair will complete any room.
Taking a break outside is even better when you have a nice chair to sit on. Guaranteed to reduce stress with every outdoor respite.

Everyone compares themselves to their friends and neighbors, but this chair lets you feel smugly superior in regards to your love and compassion for mother earth. With a molded backing made from 100% recycled yogurt cups, you can take comfort in knowing that you recycle. So the next time you have company over, make sure they know that their trash is definitely your treasure. Treasure you can sit on!

These chairs were part of an experimental furnishings study at the University of Britechester entitled "Do Chairs Have Feelings?" the result was hundreds of homeless chairs at the end of the experiment. While it was never determined if the chairs could feel, the research did determine that their unconventional design spruces up any living area.

Another masterpiece by up-and-coming furniture whisperer JaJa Henrich! Using discarded shipping crates and weathered burlap from a sketchy warehouse outside San Myshuno, JaJa's skillful design creates a chair with a past way cooler than anyone you know. I mean, this chair grew up in the streets and probably has mafia ties... but has a heart of gold and would definitely help your kid with their homework if it was sentient. Don't judge a chair by its burlap cover.

Why did Tchaikovsteen leave his Jersey Symphony in B major unfinished? Because sometimes enough is enough. Take this chair for example. The important areas have been kinda stylishly upholstered with rustic, “found around town” materials. The rest of it? Not so much - And why would it be anyway? You don’t park your buetox on the back of it. Am I right?
Dilettante Chair – by Iffie Design & Construction

Simplicity and sustainability often go hand-in-hand and this chair is no exception! With a cushion crafted from recycled cotton dryer lint, you can lounge in style and think twice before you throw out that giant lint ball from the dryer. Instead, you can mail it to Lintwell Inc. and we will happily weave it into lounge chair magic.
Linty Fresh Lounge chair - by Lintwell Inc.
This outdoor couch will improve the scenery and make the refreshing breeze even sweeter.

Not the most comfortable of sofas, but sure is the most... alive?! Made with concrete and wood slats, this sofa might be more suited for an outdoor experience, but who says we can't have it both ways indoors? This sofa comes complete with its own piece of the garden, perfect for those without outdoors spaces to let a bit of the outside... in.

Refreshed and ready for any living room. Comfy for family and friends alike. Putting all that wasted garbage to good use, this couch has transformed into something that any recycle buff would be proud of. Show off your selflessness and concern for the neighborhood by rebuilding what was once just a trash pile full of old soda cans, leftovers and the keys you accidentally threw away into something beautiful.
The couch might be fabricated, but the comfort it provides is the real deal. A must have for those looking for something fabulous and functional.

Designed by up-and-coming furniture whisperer JaJa Henrich from materials found in an abandoned warehouse on the outskirts of San Myshuno, this sofa challenges our preconceived notions of comfort. Using discarded shipping crates and weathered burlap, JaJa's skillful design and careful treatment of fabric proves just because something had a hard past doesn't mean it was not destined to provide comfort to others. Makes you think!
Harness the power of the sun! Then use it for you own maniacal schemes! (Or to power your house.) Just remember to keep your panels clean, or they won't be doing much harnessing will they?

The sun likes to play peek-a-boo, and when it pops out... this roof solar panel is ready! It'll snatch up those rays before they knew what hit them, transforming them into pure power. Hello power utility, I seeee you~

Dig it if you will. There are real square coffee tables and then there are Way Gone Cat Coffee Tables. They’re tables so righteous that they became coffee tables because it was a way out blast to live in the moment of pure coffee tableness. Repurposed from the espresso drenched floor planks of all the nifty Joe Joints that ever embraced the cookin’ beat poet, these are the real deal, daddy-O. Not some poser coffee table. Close your peepers & listen closely. You can almost totally dig the nonsensical word pairings and fingers snapping sounds reverberating in each plank.

Not ready to go "full mosaic"? For those who want a subtle "mosaic-like" feel to their coffee table without committing to a full mosaic, we are offering a lovely compromise! This partial mosaic table is inlayed with upcycled shower tile for a whimsical addition to any room.
A basic dining table with a vintage feel. This piece has been restored to original condition, and goes perfectly with the Refurbished Chair creating a set that is both simple and economical.
The perfect place to sit down for family dinner. Homemade food goes best with homemade furniture.

Made with ethically sourced and recycled Granite Falls Wood, this table is a visual experience in itself that can add to the sensory experience that is home dining. Dinner taking too long? No problems here, you can look at the gradient of colours and make it a game while you wait for your superb Goopy Carbonara.

A little table, but with a lot of character. Simple base made with the sturdiest of irons and polished wood for maximum clutter or lighting display.\n\nNo assembly required as it comes pre-assembled and pre-potentially returned, unless otherwise specified.
Lamps, sculptures, and the remote that you’ve been looking for for months will look great on this trendy end table.

Add some colour to your life! This is the best little table for indoors, and it can go just about anywhere. The top is a mosaic made and designed by San Myshuno graphic artists, conveying their love of color, the individuality of personality, and unique shapes, creating an eclectic piece that gives a room a much needed pop of color.\n\nWhether it is placed in the living room, the bedroom, and hey... why not the bathroom? It has a large enough load-bearing capacity and is waterproof and moisture-proof.

From the makers and designers of the award winning Lumbered Pixels Dining Table, we have a matching table to display clutter and decor. Though we don't usually design to be extremely matchy-matchy with our furniture, this piece is a fabulous addition to the set that you can use with or without the other units. Need a place to put your keys and whatever your mailman leaves in your mailbox without forgetting where it is? Need a place to display accents that will brighten any room? Look no further, this table not offers space, but also a visual experience when trying to figure out how they made those colors variations so seamlessly.

The perfect table for the DIY, or the Rustic Aesthetic enthusiast. This table is made in a wicked weave design that will make you wonder how did this actually get made? Made from upcycled and imported materials from Sulani, it is environmentally friendly and sturdy. This table comes also insulated (unless it actually catches fire) so you can use it without worrying about safety.

Here at Furniture-Go-Round our pieces are sustainably upcycled using everything from flea market flat-pack castoffs to abandoned DIY bookshelfs. If it can be shredded and repurposed, we'll take it and craft the sturdy, stately pieces you see today. Is it an antique? Possibly at one point, part of it might have been. But one thing is for sure: it ain't teak!
Aint Teak Hallway Table by Furniture-Go-Round

When you gotta do some “personal recycling”, why not do it atop the #2 name in recycled material toilets -The See-Thru Loo? It’s got a big old hunk of repurposed, translucent Simsunite TM right in the bowl so you can keep an eye on your progress. Simply put, dooing your business anywhere else would be nobody else’s business.
The See-Thru Loo – by TMI Industries
A highly renewable, eco-friendly form of fuel made from rendered insect biomass.

With great power comes great responsibility. With one mighty suck of the Eco-Matic Smog Vacuum, Sims can quickly reduce pollution in their environment, but beware, responsible disposal is also needed. Or is it?

You know, Dumpsters get a bad rep, don’t they? Sure, they’re vile and smelly. And yeah, maybe they’re covered in a revolting mystery crust that makes you want to forget today ever happened.

But did you ever think that maybe, just maybe, somewhere deep within the depths of that repulsive and misunderstood receptacle awaits the new crowning jewel of your mother’s sitting room? Or maybe quietly nestled below the dank funk of this repugnant vessel is the rare ingredient to your new favorite dish?

I guess what I’m trying to say here is, maybe it’s time we give trash a chance. This here is A Very Fine Dumpster.

The product of industrious bees, this wax may be stolen and used to make candles.

You do everything you can for the planet. You recycle. You reduce. You re-use. You close the loop. You dig through your neighbors' trash picking out yogurt containers. There comes a point where you should take the time to admire the planet. So take a moment and stare out at its beauty through this angled bay-style window. You've earned it.
Angled Staring Window – by Distended Window Inc.

You do everything you can for the planet. You recycle. You reduce. You re-use. You close the loop. You dig through your neighbors' trash picking out yogurt containers. There comes a point where you should take the time to admire the planet. So take a moment and stare out at its beauty through this angled bay-style window. You've earned it.\n\nNow taller!
Bigger Angled Staring Window – by Distended Window Inc.

You do everything you can for the planet. You recycle. You reduce. You re-use. You close the loop. You dig through your neighbors' trash picking out yogurt containers. There comes a point where you should take the time to admire the planet. So take a moment and stare out at its beauty through this angled bay-style window. You've earned it.\n\nDefinitely taller, can't complain here, for viewing more of the planet!
The Biggest Angled Staring Window We've Got – by Distended Window Inc.

For our "Hey, remember the 90s?" collection, we've melted fax machines down into this sturdy statement piece window. For extra fun, stand in the window and do your best fax machine impression. Notice the double paned glass protects passersby from the horrible, soul-sucking screeches that plagued a generation of office workers.
Recycled Fax Machine Window – By Distended Window Inc.

You just can’t make 3 meter high windows as razor thin as this without starting from recycled materials. In fact, these windows are SO thin that you can see right through them. Now that’s thin to win!
Thindows III – by Wispy Witto Window Corp.

You just can’t make 4 meter high windows as razor thin as this without starting from recycled materials. In fact, these windows are SO thin that you can see right through them. Now that’s thin to win!
Thindows IV – by Wispy Witto Window Corp.

You just can’t make 5 meter high windows as razor thin as this without starting from recycled materials. In fact, these windows are SO thin that you can see right through them. Now that’s thin to win!
Thindows V – by Wispy Witto Window Corp.

Is it just me or does this window give you an overwhelming urge to fill it with small blue pebbles, a pirate skeleton, some water & about 20 exotic goldfish? That’s because it used to be an aquarium. Now it’s been re-purposed into a big old window with a fish eye view of the world. Stand in front of it & pretty soon someone will come by and over feed you.
Aquarium Window – by Distended Window Inc.

We wondered what it would be like to melt down broken windows into brand new windows...and now it's here! Presenting a window made from thousands of shards of other windows given a new life of clarity. To gaze through this window is to gaze through the views of all the windows from its past... but more likely than not, your regular life, views of pigeons and nosy squirrels will remain the same.

We melted down old broken windows into brand new windows! To gaze through this window is to gaze through the views of all the windows from its past. Dramatic? Maybe. Efficient? Definitely! And with the Even More Infinite Window, you get even MORE window. A bargain? Clearly!

We melted down old broken windows into brand new windows! To gaze through this window is to gaze through the views of all the windows from its past. Dramatic? Maybe. Efficient? Definitely! And with the Way More Infinite Window, you get the most window of all our windows. A bargain? Clearly!

Let the sunshine in! But don't be TOO hasty about it. This decorative window screen has several functions including an eco-friendly way to discourage bug trespassers, and of course, letting the perfect amount of sunshine in. Not only does natural light help you save on your electric bill, but it takes a pretty good selfie too. Now available in this slightly smaller version!

Let the sunshine in! But don't be TOO hasty about it. This decorative window screen has several functions including an eco friendly way to discourage bug trespassers, and of course, letting the perfect amount of sunshine in. Not only does natural light help you save on your electric bill, but it takes a pretty good selfie too.

Some things in life are better in wedge form. Iceberg wedge salads with ranch dressing, wedges of cheese, certain footwear and now windows! That's right. We've taken window design and wedged our own take into it. Try it out! Just don't cover it in ranch dressing. Save that for the iceberg wedges, please.

Some things in life are better in wedge form. Iceberg wedge salads with ranch dressing, wedges of cheese, certain footwear and now windows! That's right. We've taken window design and wedged our own take into it. Try it out! Just don't cover it in ranch dressing. Save that for the iceberg wedges, please.
A bigger model of our wedge window. Try it out and let it wedge its way into your hearts and homes! Like a wedge of cake... it's more fun with more than one.
A bigger model of our wedge window. Try it out and let it wedge its way into your hearts and homes! Like a wedge of cake... it's more fun with more than one.

Finally, an eco-friendly window for the lefty in your life. It boasts plenty of glass for right handed window gazers plus an extra bunch of square footages of glass that lefties can really use. Makes a great gift!
The Southpaw III – by Distended Window Inc.

Featuring a frame made of compressed broken phone cases, this window reminds us to occasionally gaze outside rather than at our phones. After all, at any given time, there might be a squirrel outside.
There May Be a Squirrel Outside Window

Is there really a bird outside? Without a window as clear and fashionable as this, you might never know. You could potentially hear the bird, but see it? Forget it! Still, even without a bird, this window offers pristine views of the outside world. *Bird sighting not guaranteed.
There May Be a Bird Outside Window

For those who prefer the comforts of home rather than the uncertainty of the "outside world," staying in all day sounds pretty great. But what if there comes a time when you want to be reassured that the outside world still exists? Staring at a solid wall becomes fairly tiring on the eyes after a while, and no matter how good your imagination is, it can't replace a window, so why not try one of ours? There's no reason to wonder. The existence of an outside world is yours to confirm!
There May Be an Outside Window

All that wind, blowing high through the air... If only there was a way to reach it and harness it's power... Oh wait. There is. As the wind spins this turbine's propeller-blades, an internal generator is activated, creating a source of off-the-grid power.

This roof-mounted wind turbine is situated perfectly to catch those blustering breezes, blowing belligerently through the air. As the wind spins the propeller-blades, an internal generator is activated, creating a source of off-the-grid power.
An old port building now owned by the community, The Waterfront is always the "next" revitalization project, but seems to have a hard time getting the love and attention it deserves.

To be honest, this lot isn't even officially zoned for residential living, but this affordable home of converted shipping containers - not to mention the views of the Sound! - is the perfect place for anyone looking for a simple place to call home.
This beautifully repurposed space that sits at the base of the Croftville Dam is a meeting-place of past and present, as a modern home lives in the shell of a classic wood mill.

Bess and Jules are a power couple with big dreams. Big dreams about sweet, sweet money. A Civil Designer by trade, Bess placed herself in the perfect position to convince city officials and residents alike to enact programs that would benefit her bottom line. Her partner-in-crime, Jules, is a Style Influencer that loves fashion as much as he loves convincing people to buy his rejected styles. Cheerful and charismatic, together they hustle around Evergreen Harbor like an entrepreneurial whirlwind.
This old train station is now the perfect place to house a simple bar where people can get together and talk about a time when there was an old train station here.
Situated right past the entrance gate to Port Promise, this lot provides gorgeous views of the old port while within walking distance to most of the local landmarks.

Mary and Blossom are a couple of old timers in this town. They're trying to spruce up the place, with Mary focused on her garden and Blossom painting up unused spaces. Age isn't on their side anymore, however. It's a good thing their adopted son Knox is fighting for the family name to help make the world a little more green. Unfortunately, sometimes he takes "fighting" a little too literally.
This cozy two-bedroom apartment puts you right in the heart of Conifer Station with easy walking access to the local community space. Enjoy the view from the private balcony!
This tidy little two-bedroom has you in the heart of Conifer Station, just a few steps away from the local community space.

What used to be a gathering ground for Sims awaiting loved ones arriving on the train has seen better days, but the prime location means a few simple updates could have Sprucewood Square thriving once more.
A small slice of home with a yard, a view of the canal, and the memory of the chimes of yesteryear from the train station clock tower.

Built by railroad financier Gregory Pigulock during the early development of Evergreen Harbor, this mansion twice suffered damage from local storms before being declared a historic landmark and being restored to its current glory.

The talented, but perpetually stressed Tina Tinker is a very successful Freelance Crafter. Her equally successful spouse, Yasemin, managed to convince her to move to Conifer Station with their daughter, Olive. Tina takes on too much work, and Yasemin just wants her to relax and spend more time with family. Meanwhile, curious little Olive loves nothing more than to admire her two mothers' works and dream of following in their footsteps.
The quarry has been shut down for years, but the building still stands, ready for a makeover that'll transform it from lonely and obsolete to new and fun at parties.
A modest lot built near the remains of Grims Quarry, this home benefits from some of the fresh water unearthed by past digging at the quarry.

At the time, this was one of the largest homes built near the quarry by a successful miner working the stones. Despite not being a real mansion, it enjoys heritage status today and is a solid home for any family looking for a place in Evergreen Harbor.

Cletus and Faye found this heritage home in Grims Quarry for dirt cheap. Nothing seems wrong with it, and the Harris' weren't about to question a good deal. Cletus' free-spirited mother soon joined them, completing the big, happy family. Mysteriously, their eldest son always wears a shameful bag on his head. Also, it doesn't seem like any of them other than Faye has a job, but the house is well furnished. What is going on here?
This standard one-bedroom apartment only minutes away from the Quarry Building is perfect for a single Sim or couple looking for an inexpensive place to live in Evergreen Harbor.
This standard one-bedroom apartment only minutes away from the Quarry Building is perfect for a single Sim or couple looking for an inexpensive place to live in Evergreen Harbor.
Pfft... leave? You're not the boss of me...
Okay fine I'll leave... but please heed my advice. The trees are watching.

Breathe in deep, breathe out slowly. Keep taking good care of yourselves, dear neighbors.

I can't fish, anything I try to grow dies, and everything I touch breaks. I understand how the Self-Sufficiency N.A.P. is supposed to help, but I think I have to leave this street.
I never have to go to the store for food again! I never did before because of my magical fridge, but I sure don't have to anymore now that our community's become so self-sufficient.
The melodies coming from this street are enchanting. Keep it up!

Cool cool cool. Thanks for the ear, Champ. {0.SimName}, at your service and let's just say I am a bit of an Entrepreneur when it comes to business dealings. Do you want to make some quick money fast? Of course you do! And you know I'm your go-to Sim, so let's go get this bread! The more we get into dealing with some serious Simoleons here, the more we'll need to start voting on Neighborhood Action Plans. Do you know about those? There are some prime initiatives for us money-makers to vote for:
  • Modern Development
  • Tech Support
  • Promote Creative Arts
But don’t get caught N.A.P.ing on your right to vote (Get it?) I’ve given you a few Influence Points from my personal stash to get you started. You can vote at either a public Voting Board or even at your own Mailbox. Voting ends on {2.DayOfWeekLong} at {2.TimeShort}! Check the Simology Panel (Y) for more info!

Welcome to Evergreen Harbor! My name's {0.SimFirstName} and - not to toot my own horn - but people regard me as a bit of an Eco Master around these parts. And I utterly love talking about living the Eco Lifestyle. Did you know that you can vote on Neighborhood Action Plans? They’re called N.A.P.s for short. If you want to help get our neighborhood to a better Eco Footprint, there are a lot of great options you can help me in supporting. Do it for the trees!
  • Green Initiatives
  • Eco-Friendly Appliances
  • Clean Energy Production
Voting is easy! You can Vote at either a public Voting Board or even at your own Mailbox. No excuses to dodge voting! Just make sure you have enough Influence Points. I’ve given you a few to get you started. Voting ends on {2.DayOfWeekLong} at {2.TimeShort}! Check the Simology Panel (Y) for more info.

True art cannot be recreated, unless it’s in a Fabricator. This conversation starter wall decor will add a touch of refinement to any household.

Sandwiched between rolling hills of evergreen forest on one side and the waters of the Willupette Sound on the other, Evergreen Harbor used to be the industrial hub of the region. However, as the world changed around it, the region has struggled to keep up. A place where Sims value their community and neighborly love isn't just a pastime, Evergreen Harbor now stands on the precipice of making its own future. The only question is: what kind of future will it be?
(When submitted Eco-Invention Concepts are approved, new inventions can be unlocked and crafted on the Fabricator)

Whether you do - or you don't - have a green thumb, these roof sheets are perfect for those that wish to add a little life to their lots. Go greener instantly upon installing this beautiful roof sheets. Shades of grass will vary.
Perfectly corrugated and repurposed for any roof, any size. Made strictly with recycled metal, making a difference, one sheet at a time.

Upcycled from the abandoned containers from Laandgrab Industries. This metal sheet might look heavy metal, but it isn't heavy at all. Do not let its origins fool you, this is a great alternative for an industrial look.
It might be an investment, but a solar tile roof can power your home, saving on power bills overtime. Also, look how glossy! Ooooo.

{0.SimFirstName} is doing an audit of some Community Space Project voting patterns, and discovers that the votes for a recently enacted Project were incorrectly counted! Will the public be angry about that Community Garden instead of a Marketplace, or will they not care?

{0.SimFirstName} installed some expensive surveying equipment along the local riverbank to gauge flood defense building, but a colossal storm swept through and it has been washed away. Maybe they could have been more careful about its placement, or checked the weather forecast?

{0.SimFirstName} has developed a new product that hugely decreases power consumption of popular electronics with no loss of performance. After enthusiastically supporting the invention, Lean Green Design Co-Op discovers a way that reduces the eco-credentials for more profit. As the inventor should {0.SimFirstName} agree or disagree with this?

As a qualified Green Technician, {0.SimFirstName} has been involved in a project to improve the water quality to the local neighborhood. {F0.She}{M0.He} discovers that the technology might be flawed and may even cause damage to Sim's homes! This is a big contract, so should they stop installing or carry on?

{0.SimFirstName} is involved in the reconstruction of a derelict lot. The lot is in a prime position, and petitions have been submitted for a shiny new miniaturized nuclear power facility (safe, cheap and infinite energy for all) or an eco-park (combining beauty, water reclamation and green space all-in-one). Do they banish power problems forever, or build a peaceful eco-oasis?

{0.SimFirstName} has designed a radical new vision for Town Hall. With a solar spire and water reclamation technologies, this civic building looks like a cross between a cathedral and a base on the Moon! It is bold, but is it too bold?

A string of recent errors compounded by this easy to avoid mistake causes a lack of confidence in the planning authorities. {0.SimFirstName}'s boss gives them a stern telling off and warning about future mistakes.
The local community really appreciates {0.SimFirstName}'s honesty and their trust is increased!
{0.SimFirstName}'s boss did a secondary audit and saw their clumsy cover up. {0.SimFirstName} is in hot water!
{0.SimFirstName}'s subterfuge pays off. A gift from the company that manages the Community Garden trickles down as a bonus for {0.SimFirstName}.
With a large write-off for lost equipment, the planning department finds {0.SimFirstName} incompetent in not researching a better place for the monitoring gear.
With such unpredictable recent weather, {0.SimFirstName}'s boss can't blame them for the equipment loss, but recognises that future planning should include weather contingency.
The bill for the lost equipment is significant, losing {0.SimFirstName} their next performance bonus. A lesson hopefully learned.

When the equipment was washed away, the loss of signal caused a general alarm to be raised which forewarns local properties of the flood, giving them time to save their possessions. {0.SimFirstName} is hailed as a hero!
Lean Green Design Co-Op is unhappy with {0.SimFirstName}'s stubborn resistance to their excellent suggestions, and withdraws their support.
Pushing for maximum eco-benefit pays off! {0.SimFirstName}'s product is hailed as a revolution.
News gets out that the product does not deliver on the original design promise. {0.SimFirstName}'s reputation takes the hit.
Despite the reduced efficiency, customers are still delighted with results! {0.SimFirstName}'s bonus is assured.
{0.SimFirstName}'s credibility takes a hammering when customers houses start flooding. It will take a while to build up that trust again...
Due in no small part to {0.SimFirstName}'s skill as an engineer, the effect of the technology flaw is minimized.
With this delay, Sims are seeking out other Green Technicians to install their solutions. Sadly, this is causing a loss of business for {0.SimFirstName}
In revealing the flaws in the process and offering to fix existing problems, {0.SimFirstName} has gained a lot of credibility in the neighborhood.

{0.SimFirstName} feels the backlash of the protests against such an irresponsible decision to house a potentially dangerous hazard so close to residential housing. This does not go unnoticed by {0.SimFirstName}'s boss.
Sims love the cheap power and skilled jobs on offer at the plant. A bonus is on the way to {0.SimFirstName}'s bank account!
While having a green park nearby might benefit the local wildlife, locals are incensed about the loss of cheap energy and skilled jobs.
{0.SimFirstName}'s eco-credentials in the community are nailed on with their decision to designate the lot as a green haven.
The people are outraged. Why do they need a new Town Hall at astronomical cost that looks like a cheap sci-fi movie set? {0.SimFirstName} is not popular with {F0.her}{M0.his} boss right now...
What a radical approach! Plaudits flood in for the brave design decisions which gains attention on the global stage. {0.SimFirstName} is lauded.
Images from the original design are leaked on Simstagram. The community can't believe an opportunity for such a landmark has been missed.

Realizing that this community might not be quite ready for this level of innovation, {0.SimFirstName} scales back the design to something much safer and more boring. Reception among more conservative Sims is positive!
{0.SimFirstName} found some recycled materials {F0.she}{M0.he} could put to good use!
Yum. This tasty morsel belongs in a garden or in your belly - not the dumpster. Check {0.SimFirstName}'s inventory.
Oh, some bugs! Check {0.SimFirstName}'s inventory for the creepy critter.
{0.SimFirstName} scrounged up a dirty meal. Check {0.SimFirstName}'s inventory to feast on the dish.

Within the gullet of this metal beast, {0.SimFirstName} has gathered {1.Money} for {F0.her}{M0.his} coffers.

Some objects that can create Water and Power utility even while off-the-grid are the: Wind Turbine, Water Generator, Dew Collector, Power Generator, and Solar Panel. As long as a household produces more Power or Water than it uses, objects that use utilities will continue to work.

Our community values reducing and recycling. But - has anyone else noticed that the paper bags are starting to pile up? We wouldn’t dare throw those away! They could come to good use some day! Don't you think every last one of those 8,346 neatly folded pieces of untapped potential have finally earned their time to shine? With the We Wear Bags Action Plan, we can proudly wear our bags as a mark of our Eco Lifestyles.

Some Sims own a lot of things. Some Sims own just a little bit of things. But what if everyone could just own everything? See that bike sitting there? That could be your bike! Or anyone’s bike! With this initiative, everything you see can be yours. You see something, you take it. No questions asked, no repercussions. Just don’t get too attached to anything you already own...

Neighbors, I think we could all benefit from a good N.A.P. One that promotes even the smallest changes to help make a difference.\n\nTogether we can push to fix our neighborhood one appliance at a time. Let's take action into our own hands by making Handiness skill and Influence easier to get by using green-upgraded appliances or by repairing any appliance.

Feeling down about the state of our fair Port Promise? Vote on additional funding for development projects to help this area live up to its name. By putting in hard work and funding, mainly funding, together we can work on some much needed upgrades to the area.

Don't be put off by the increase in your weekly Bills to help pay for these improvements. We're pushing to ensure residents' career pay goes up to help offset the added costs.

Make this promise to Port Promise, won't you?

Sometimes Green doesn't mean completely green, but at least a step towards it. It's time to blanket Port Promise with luscious plant life.

With this Action Plan in place, we can expect to see not only trees and bushes sprouting, but we'll also see Port Promise's Eco Footprint become more Green as well.

All it takes is a small donation from residents in the form a weekly bill increase. Simple!

The lovely Conifer Station is pretty green already, but what if it were more Green in all respects of the word? With a teensy donation from residents in the form of a weekly increase in utility bills, we will be able to fund the planting of many luscious trees, hedges, and more, which will in turn give Conifer Station a greener Eco Footprint. Everybody wins!

Sure, there might be a smattering of grass around Grims Quarry, but is that enough? With this Action Plan in place, we can finally fund the experimental use of a new evergreen fertilizer that we're confident will bring a flurry of lovely pines to Grims Quarry!

This won't only make the neighborhood more green in the visual sense, but the influx of CO2 will also move our Eco Footprint to a Greener state.

Vote now, don't worry about that slight increase in your weekly bills, and let's paint the town Green!

Having seen other cities in the greater Evergreen Harbor area, it's easy to compare and acknowledge there's work that could be done at Conifer Station to keep up with the times. By putting funding towards changes in this district, you will start to see new projects roll out with the apartments, railways, and the towers.\n\nOf course, funding for this development will have to come from somewhere. With this initiative, weekly Utility Bills will be increased, but we'll also put in place an increase in residents' career pay to offset that added cost.

Do you ever look around and think "this place stinks"? That's because it does actually smell a bit like old carpet. It's ok. We can admit it. We live in an area surrounded by some impressive advancements, but Grims Quarry is still outdated for today's standards. With enough funding we can make Grims Quarry a better place to live. Vote for the Modern Development Project, and expect modern advancements at the quarry itself, in the Park, and even on the homes in Grims Quarry.

Have you always had the yearning to start gardening but never quite had the gumption to do it?

Well, this fresh new N.A.P. might be just the thing to push you over that figurative mound of procrastination soil.

Grab your snips, cast your vote, and you'll get Influence for flexing your mighty green thumb. Growing a garden is beneficial for you, the community, and the planet. Let's all dig in!

We have the luxury of living in a world that provides us with everything we need. We just need to learn how to harness that energy!\n\nWith the Clean Energy N.A.P. in place, members of the community will be rewarded with Influence for owning functional clean energy-producing objects like Solar Panels, Wind Turbines, and Dew Collectors.

Why spend your Simoleons on something you could create for yourself? Why do we throw away so many materials that could go into making something special and new? With the Upcycling Initiative, we are giving Influence to everyone using Recyclers to get materials and Fabricators to turn those materials into something responsibly wonderful!

Energy isn't free, so what can we do on our part to help conserve? The Power Conservation Action Plan helps to answer that difficult question. Step 1: Limit your household’s overall consumption of Power by avoiding overuse of electronics.* Step 2: Sacrifice one teensy weensy day per week without Power. The Landgraab Power Company even agreed to give a discount on utility bills for this. *Failure to conserve a satisfactory amount of Power for your household size, as defined by the Board of N.A.P. will result in a daily fine. Please thoroughly enjoy your day.
Power has been shut off in accordance with the Power Conservation N.A.P. It will resume on Thursday at 9pm.

Let’s admit it. The water isn’t quite flowing with the flow with which it used to flow. How can we all chip in and help to conserve? We believe that with the pairing of a weekly Water Shut-off Day and an organized effort to Consume Less Water*, this community can really make a difference!\n\n*Failure to conserve a satisfactory amount of Water for your household size, as defined by the Board of N.A.P. will result in a daily fine. Have a nice day.
Water has been shut off in accordance with the Water Conservation Neighborhood Action Plan. It will resume on Wednesday at 9pm.

Have you ever heard another Sim's opinion and thought, "I should be polite but I really think this conversation would be better if I asserted my stance, refused to back down, and ultimately engaged in a full-out neighborly brawl"? We’re with you. Sometimes we believe there is such a thing as being too polite. We should band together to make this world better, one fight cloud at a time. A world where we can speak our minds without any hurt feelings or bruised egos. Vote for the Roughhousing Encouraged N.A.P. and you can gain Influence by using Mean interactions on other Sims. If that’s the kind of Sim you want to be.

The mark of a true artistic community is a shared passion for the Creative Arts. Support this maker mindset with your vote, and you'll be rewarded not only with the pride you get from creating, but also with Influence from doing Painting, Photography, Writing, Fabrication, and other artistic activities. Professionals working as Painters, Style Influencers, Freelance Crafters, or Writers will also earn increased pay while this N.A.P. is active.

Who needs negativity when you could be drenched in love?

Who needs jealousy when you could be embraced with understanding?

Vote with your heart and we can transform our community into a butterfly of love for all. Whether Single, Married, or just open, we embrace loving each other in all of its beautiful forms.

When Free Love reigns, you can gain Influence through Romance interactions.

Recreation should be celebrated, not stifled! It's time to eradicate boredom and embrace having fun.\n\nVote for this N.A.P. and not only will we be able to let loose as a whole, but residents will also be rewarded with Influence for doing activities that involve Comedy, Mischief, and even Video Gaming!

Neighbors, let's get cooking! There are so many fabulous organic, non-organic, home-grown, and freebie ingredient options out there. Crack out that cutting board and start experimenting!\n\nUnder the Foodies Unite N.A.P., members of the community will be rewarded Influence by exercising their tasty skills in home style, Gourmet, or any other style of cooking.

Get ready to get JUICED! In support of all things fizzy and funky, this N.A.P. wants to get everyone juiced up.\n\nGain Influence by using the practical Juice Fizzing and Mixology skills to make concoctions for the entire neighborhood.

There are some who say Music is healing for the soul and Performing is healing for the heart. Uplift our community and gain Influence by not only sharing the melodies of the Instruments that you play, but also by expressing other forms of Performing Arts. Professionals working in Entertainment-related Careers can also enjoy increased pay while this N.A.P. is active.

I remember the good old days. We used to play board games and read books. Nowadays, all anyone can think about is their phone and their TV. They’re juicing it up, chugging all their wretched… juice. And what’s with this obsession with woohoo? Woohoo in the bed, Woohoo in the Rocket Ship, Woohoo in the hot tub, Woohoo in the observatory, and if that wasn’t enough - now you delinquents are woohooing in Dumpsters? Gross. With this initiative, those who live a wholesome lifestyle of reading books and playing board games will be rewarded with Influence. And those who indulge in technology, drinking juice, and woohoo will be properly fined for their woeful deeds.

What better way to care for oneself than with the accountability of a whole community?

This initiative puts the "Action" back in Neighborhood Action Plans.

Together we can make sure all Sims in the neighborhood are practicing their Fitness, keeping up on Hygiene, looking after their overall wellbeing, and boosting their Influence while they're at it!

Why keep feeding the corporate beast and continue spinning on this degrading hamster wheel of consumerist shame? We can rise up and maintain a perfectly good community ourselves! We can live in a community where things like Fishing, Gardening, and Handiness are rewarded with increased Influence, as well as a sense of accomplishment.

Have you grown too comfortable with things just the way they are? Don't be caught N.A.P.ing on your community's technological progress.

Working with Programming, Rocket Science, or other methods, we can continue to make our world a better place through technology and boosting our Influence while doing it.

As an added bonus, Sims working in tech-related Career fields such as Astronauts, Tech Gurus, Scientists, Freelance Programmers, and Civil Designers will also have increased pay if this initiative gets voted in.

Because of the community vote for Green Initiatives in Port Promise, these docks are about to get a lot greener! Within the course of the next week, residents will see more and more bushes and trees sprouting up in the area.

Some Sims like green. Other Sims might prefer a dustier shade of gray. So be it. Because of the Repeal of Green Initiatives in Port Promise, the freshly-planted trees must go. Expect to see a reduction in green in the course of the upcoming week.\n\nDon't worry, the trees will be replanted somewhere they will be better appreciated.
Port Promise has officially become more Green! This concludes all planting efforts for Green Initiatives in Port Promise. Enjoy the fresh air!

And with one last pluck of a bewildered sapling, thus concludes the removal of all changes brought by the Green Initiatives.\n\nPort Promise has been successfully returned to its gray and sepia roots.
All planting efforts for Green Initiatives in Conifer Station have been completed! Residents, enjoy your greener, fresher neighborhood!\n\nYou've earned it.
The last of the uprooting has been achieved. The residents of Conifer Station now live in a neighborhood that is less Green.

The votes have been tallied, and it has been decided that Confer Station does indeed need more plant life and greenery! The planting for Green Initiatives will begin immediately!\n\nResidents can look forward to some lovely green changes taking place over the next week.
And just like that, Green Initiatives in Conifer Station, Repealed. May the plucking commence!

This place <i>reeks<i/> of evergreen! Great job, residents of Grimms Quarry. The fertilizer experiment was a wild success (thank goodness) and you can now enjoy a greener Eco Footprint, as well as a blanket of prickly new forest friends.
And so completes the deforestation in accordance with the Repeal of Green Initiatives in Grims Quarry. I hope nobody got too attached to those trees...
Green Initiatives in Grims Quarry has been passed! Looks like that experimental evergreen fertilizer the community has funded is already working! Just smell that sap... delicious.

Not to get too sappy, but I for one am really going to miss all of these delightful conifers. But the law is the law, and Green Initiatives in Grims Quarry has been repealed. The deforestation process will begin immediately.\n\nDon't worry, we'll find a new home for these noble pines.
The community's funding has helped pay for a scrub down and a striking cyan paint job for the crane by the docks. So shiny!
That cyan hue on the crane was wonderful while it lasted, but without funding to pay for cleaning and upkeep, it has quickly degraded to its former rusty state.

With Port Promise's final and most exciting Modern update, we've saved the best for last! We've hired a team of local artisans to give the refinery a vibrant new artistic look. They've really outdone themselves with colorful brick work on the ground surrounding the area, vibrant art pieces lining the walkway, and a delightful trio of Void Critter murals on the tank.\n\nAnd that concludes our transformation. On to new territory for Port Promise!

Now that the funding is gone, we figured we'd be proactive and just remove all the nice artwork around the refinery. Upkeep would have been pricey. With that, the removal of all advancements brought with Modern Development in Port Promise has concluded. Port Promise is back to its dreary origins.

The new streets have been getting such rave reviews that we funneled some of our funding into some new, more modern brickwork around our walkways.\n\nNow the residents of Port Promise can step in and on style!
Turns out that fancy new brickwork was pricey to maintain. At the sign of the first crack, we figured it was best to just revert the area back to the concrete slabs we had before.

The votes are in and Modern Development in Port Promise starts right now! This port does indeed have a lot of promise, so let’s see what contemporary improvements lie ahead. To kick off development, the center streets have been paved with a luxurious experimental pavement made from recycled astroturf that leads to a striking propeller modern art piece. This handsome, historic propeller was flown in as a way for Port Promise to commemorate our history, while also looking toward our bright future. More changes ahead in the following week!
The experimental roads had a fundamental flaw in their design. Without extra funding from the community, Port Promise had to revert back to the original pavement rather than pay for the replacement.

The Modern Development in Conifer Station Neighborhood Action Plan is now in effect. The increase in residents' household bills will feel like a small sacrifice in comparison to the breathtaking advancements we'll all soon be enjoying. The apartment block in Conifer Station has already undergone a sophisticated modern face lift with an update to the look of the apartment buildings, as well as a modern renovation to the surrounding sidewalk.
Apartment development is a sound investment, but without proper upkeep, things tend to degrade to their outdated state. Now without funding, they will stay outdated.

The modern updates made to the apartment block were so strikingly executed, we figured why stop there? We’ve put a portion of the Conifer Station’s Modern Development funding towards beautifying a number of the neighborhood’s residential structures as well. This is truly a grass rooves initiative.\n\nAnd for our neighborhood's final modern update, we contracted a local Master Crafter to weld striking art pieces encircling our beloved Conifer Towers. These pieces commemorate our native ponderosa pine!
It was a valiant attempt by the community to keep Conifer Station thriving. However, a Repeal is a Repeal, and we have no choice but to return Conifer Station to its previous state.

The community’s generous donations have paid for a striking remodel to the exterior or our historic Conifer Station! As part of the remodel, we have also modernized a section of its railway overpass as a juxtaposition of where we are vs. where we were. Residents can now walk freely up the stairs to enjoy the newly refurbished interpretive site. How you interpret this site is wholly up to your personal interpretation.
Because of the Repeal of Modern Initiatives in Conifer Station, the historic railway has been returned to its previous, rickety condition.

The streets just got brighter! For the next round of changes for Modern Development in Conifer Station we’ve replaced the crusty pavement of our center streets with a marvelous sunflower mosaic. Residents of Conifer Station are sure to have more spring in their step while treading on this floral treasure.
Because of the Repeal of Modern Development in Conifer Station we can no longer afford the upkeep of our lovely sunflower streets. We are now back to basic roads.

Thanks to everyone who voted for Modern Development in Grims Quarry, this neighborhood will finally begin to realize its full potential! Using the gracious contributions from our community, residents will be able to enjoy seeing developments throughout the week.\n\nIn fact, in the Board of N.A.P. has already funneled some of the increased development budget into eco chic upgrades for many of Grims Quarry’s apartment buildings!
Since the Repeal of Modern Development in Grims Quarry, funding is quickly running out. The eco chic makeover of the apartment buildings will have to be the first thing to go...

The eco chic exteriors on the apartment buildings were starting to make our tired old residential buildings look well… old and tired. So we’ve taken the remainder of the community’s contributions and have applied an eco chic upgrade to many of the home residences of Grims Quarry as well. This concludes all planned modern upgrades funded by the Modern Development in Grims Quarry Neighborhood Action Plan. Isn’t it pretty!
Without enough funding, the residential buildings have quickly reverted back to their old, tired state.

Feast your eyes on the contemporary updates that have been made to our neighborhood’s crowning jewel, Grims Quarry. The old rusty chain link fence that used to welcome its visitors has been replaced with a stylish rusty fence made from upcycled cuts of historic ship metal.\n\nWe’re also unveiling the quarry’s limestone tribute art piece, featuring two ridiculously enormous saw blades, polished to perfection with fine organic silk.
Funding has officially dried up, much like Grims Quarry. Sadly, we've had to return the modern fencing and saw blade art piece back to where they came from. It was nice while it lasted.

The beautification of Grims Quarry continues with an absurdly stunning upgrade to our previously cracked central streets. Residents can now enjoy walking and biking on a veritable work of modern art.\n\nHow the contractors were able to pull off this level of detail and artistry within just a couple days will remain a mystery. But hey, we’ll take it!
Say bye-bye to those pretty swirly roads! With the decrease in funding, we can now only afford plain, boring asphalt.
Power Conservation Day has now ended. Thank you for your cooperation, please continue to conserve Power as best as possible.
Power Conservation Day is now in effect. All Power will be turned off for the next 12 hours. Hopefully you've planned ahead.
Water Shut-off Day has now ended. Thank you for your cooperation, please continue to conserve Water as best as possible.
Water Shut-off Day is now in effect in accordance with the Water Conservation N.A.P. All Water will be turned off for the next 12 hours.
The generator doesn't need additional fuel at this time.
Bits can be acquired from recycling objects like TVs and computers on the Recycler or looking through trash for recyclables.
Requires Level 5 Cooking or Level 9 Mischief
Insect Bio-fuel can be harvested from the Insect farm while caring for any of the beetles.
This generator doesn't need additional fuel at this time.
Pieces can be acquired from recycling objects like dirty dishes and consumables on the Recycler or looking through trash for recyclables.
(From a Green Fiend being on a Green Street)
(From a Green Fiend being on an Industrial Street)
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Dresser on the Fabricator, and the Cylindrical Candle on the Candle-Making Station.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Single Bed on the Fabricator.

{0.SimName} is beginning {F0.her}{M0.his} journey into the world of Fabrication! Creating objects on the Fabricator or crafting candles at the Candle Making table will increase {F0.her}{M0.his} Fabrication skill. Improve {F0.her}{M0.his} Fabrication skill to unlock more objects and candle types.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Dining Table, Dining Chair, Plumbing Upgrade Parts, Kitchen Upgrade Parts, and Common Upgrade Parts on the Fabricator.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Kid's Bed on the Fabricator.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Fine Wall Decor on the Fabricator.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Outdoor Couch and the Outdoor Trellis on the Fabricator, and emotional aura candles on the Candle-Making Station.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Double Bed on the Fabricator and the Carved Candle on the Candle-Making Station.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Floor Light on the Fabricator and the Rectangular Candle on the Candle-Making Station.
{0.SimFirstName} can now craft the Living Chair and Outdoor Chair on the Fabricator, as well as give crafted items as gifts.

Why buy brand name when you can make it yourself? Recycle old stuff that would be thrown out otherwise and use the Bits and Pieces to make something all your own!\n\nFabrication Skill is built by using the fabricator and by creating candles at the candle making table. Increasing this skill unlocks new recipes to explore!
The fizz speaks to {0.SimFirstName}. {M0.His}{F0.Her} mastery of the fizzer has unlocked the ability to make Seltzers on the Juice Fizzer.
{0.SimFirstName} has grasped the basics of Juice Fizzing! {M0.He}{F0.She} can now try experimenting with herbs, flowers, and soybeans.
{0.SimFirstName} has started {M0.his}{F0.her} juice fizzing journey! Continue building Juice Fizzing Skill by using the Juice Fizzer and experimenting with ingredients.

{0.SimFirstName} is approaching peak fizzing power! {M0.He}{F0.She} can now give fizzing tips, and if {M0.he}{F0.she} is feeling confident, {M0.he}{F0.she} can send fizzy products to FizzEnthusiasts for evaluation.
{0.SimFirstName} has mastered the Juice Fizzing Skill and became a certified Afizzionado! {M0.He}{F0.She} can now attempt to fizz the mysterious Grimbucha.

Sims with this skill have a natural curiosity for the art of the fizz. Whether it's a hobby or a side hustle, experimentation is key. These Sims can be found trying different ingredients and processes to hone their craft.
The look and feel of the Quarry.
Beautiful stone concrete. Looks and feels so clean!
Afizzionados become focused while creating better products from the Juice Fizzer, as well as recovering from becoming Overbucha’d faster.
A Champion of the People always gains extra Influence, extra Satisfaction Points when gaining Influence, and will find themselves the recipient of more gifts from other Sims.
This Sim is the neighborhood Eco Master! They can inspire other Sims to be eco-conscious.
An Eco-Engineer will find Eco-Upgrades to objects are completed more quickly and always get Eco-Upgrade Parts from recycling.
This Sim is the Neighborhood Entrepreneur! They like to take chances with investments and will not refuse handouts.

These Sims reject consumerism and prefer to reduce wasteful spending by any means. They enjoy finding re-used or thrown away goods and foods. In fact, they have the best luck at finding the highest-quality treasures in Dumpsters! They may become tense or uncomfortable if they spend too much time earning or spending Simoleons.
Death came for {0.SimFirstName} in the form of a well-mixed bug drink. {0.SimFirstName} can relax in a haunted house.
These Sims are happiest when living on a green street and will continuously work towards making their environment more eco-friendly.

These Sims become happy when making things. They become sad when it's been too long since completing a project on a Fabricator, Candlemaking Station, Juice Fizzer, or Woodworking Table. They do not receive negative effects from crafting or repair failures.
This Sim is the neighborhood Master Crafter! They can inspire Fabrication recipes in other Sims.
Master Makers have learned all the tricks necessary to fabricate items at a reduced cost.
From completing the Master Maker aspiration.
When Influential Individuals speak, everyone listens. They can get the community to cheer on a local hero, or cancel them on a whim.
From completing the Eco Innovator Aspiration.
These Sims are rabid recyclers that benefit from recycling and rummaging for bits and pieces, but should they go too long without indulging in their hobby...
Each of the individual venues contained within a Community Space is essentially a full venue in its own right, with its own requirements, traits, and layout.

As a player, each Community Space contains four individual lots within it. The Active lot is the one that currently appears in the world, but all four lots can be accessed in Build Mode via the Venue Info.

Community Spaces are a new lot type that allow Sims to congregate as a community and affect change. These shared spaces have the power to transform through actions Sims take on the Community Voting Board. Each Community Space can become a Community Garden, a Marketplace, or a Maker Space!

An Industrial Eco Footprint brings smog, pollution, and increased utility production of Atmospheric Water Generators and Power Generators. Fires of all kinds and trash plants all contribute to an Industrial Eco Footprint.
Neighborhoods now have a unique Eco Footprint. Landscaping, objects and the actions of the entire community push a neighborhood's Eco Footprint to become Green, Neutral, or Industrial.

A Green Eco Footprint brings fresh air, a healthy atmosphere, and increased utility production of Solar Panels, Wind Turbines and Dew Collectors. Lots with plenty of trees, garden plants and energy efficient objects contribute to a Green Eco Footprint. Community Policies promoting gardening and Green Initiatives also help!

The Candle Making Table uses Bits and Pieces, as well as dyes and wax to create various shapes and colors. Purchase or use fresh wax gathered from soy plants to create your candle. At high levels, some candles can change your Sim’s moods.

You can also make fizzy juice using the Juice Fizzer. The Juice Fizzer does not use Bits and Pieces, but it uses ingredients such as fruit. You'll first need to load the ingredients, and then start the fizzing process. When it's done, you'll retrieve your beverage from the machine. Using more ingredients will create a multi-pack of beverages. It will cost a few more Simoleons, but will be cheaper per bottle to produce.

When you use the Recycler, you will obtain a new currency called Bits and Pieces. Bits and Pieces are needed to make things in the Fabricator. You can always hover over the Household Funds or the Recycler to see how many Bits and Pieces you have.

Crafting new objects in Eco Lifestyle allows you to take old things and make them new again. The first step is to use a Recycler to recycle anything you have in your Sim's Inventory or the Household Inventory. Then, take the Bits and Pieces you've obtained from the Recycler, and create new items using the Fabricator. Diving in a Dumpster is a great way to find things you can use in the Recycler!

Click on the Fabricator to begin crafting an item. The picker will give you the choice of what item and what color. To create different colored items, you need to use dyes. Dyes can be purchased, gifted, or found while interacting with other Eco Lifestyle items.\n\nThe Fabrication Skill can be increased by making objects at the Fabricator or Candle Making Table. Leveling up will unlock more recipes for your Sim to create. These items can be made using the Bits and Pieces you receive from the Recycler.

Voting for Green Initiatives and Modern Development Action Plans can literally change what your Sims' neighborhood looks like!\n\nWhile Green Initiatives generally bring more trees and a Green effect on the neighborhood's Eco Footprint, Modern Development plans bring modern visual updates to streets, surrounding buildings, and more.

While the voting period is open, Sims can vote either at their own Mailbox or at a public Community Voting Board. All neighborhoods in Evergreen Harbor have a Voting Board on their street.\n\nDon’t live in Evergreen Harbor? No problem! In addition to using their own Mailbox, Sims can also vote from a Community Voting Board placed at any Venue lot.

There is a new Neighborhood Action Plans section in the Simology Panel (Y) that is quick access to various bits of useful Neighborhood Action Plan information. You can see how many Influence Points your active Sim currently has, what the voting schedule is, and whether or not voting is currently open or closed. If voting is currently closed, don’t worry! Voting re-opens and closes on the same days each week. This should give your Sims some time to Check Neighborhood Action Plans for next week on the Community Voting Board and work on building up their Influence.

In order to vote, a Sim needs Influence. Each vote takes 10 Influence Points and Sims can place as many votes as their current Influence affords. There are a number of ways your Sim can gain Influence, including:
  • Following the rules of an enacted Neighborhood Action Plan
  • Being active in the Civil Designer Career
  • Getting Promoted in any Career
  • Positive Introductions with other Sims
  • Becoming Friends, Good Friends, and Best Friends with other Sims
  • Giving Gifts to other Sims
  • Mentoring other Sims
  • Hosting an Event

Neighborhood Action Plans (N.A.P.s for short) are your Sim’s way to have a personal impact on how their neighborhood looks or how their community operates. These can have a variety of effects, ranging from how much Sims in the area are paid for their jobs, to how NPCs behave, to even the neighborhood’s Eco Footprint!\n\nIt’s possible for up to four Neighborhood Action Plans to be active at one time in any residential neighborhood.

NPC Sims can vote too. If your Sim would like to use NPCs to their advantage, they can rally their cause by interacting with other Sims to Convince to Support their N.A.P. of choice. If a N.A.P. is active that you don’t like or if your Sim would like to enjoy a change of scenery, your Sim always has the right to Petition to Repeal any active Plan in their neighborhood. A Repeal takes a little work. In order to successfully repeal an active N.A.P., Sims must successfully Ask for Repeal Signature from 5 other Sims before the current voting period closes.

OPTIONS To turn off NPC voting, check off the Enable NPC Voting Option in the Eco Lifestyle Options Tab CHEATS Shift+Click on any public Community Voting Board or your Sim's Mailbox to access the following cheats:
  • Instant Enact Neighborhood Action Plan
  • Instant Repeal Neighborhood Action Plan (only available if there is a current active Plan)
  • Give Sim Influence +15

There are now a variety of Water and Power utility production objects that can be purchased from Build Mode. Water and Power generated from these objects can be used to help supplement the cost of utilities on Bills. These objects will also allow a Household to operate with utilities when utilities are shut off.

To see if an object will produce or consume utility, hover over an object in the Buy Catalog. The tooltip will indicate if that object has a Power or Water Production/Consumption Rating.\n\nSome Water Production objects are the Atmospheric Water Generator and Dew Collector. Some Power Production objects are the Power Generator, Solar Panel, and Wind Turbine. Certain Lot Traits or build mode objects may also contribute to Water or Power generation or usage.

If a household generates more Power or Water utility than is consumed, excess utility may be sold. This can be done by viewing the Bills and Utilities menu on either the mailbox or the weekly Bills statement.\n\nExcess utility is set to Auto-Sell by default, but it may also be stored for future use. Preference may be selected in the Bills & Utilities menu.
Don't say you can't! Come with us and plant!
We're going to try to make our thumbs a bit greener. Come along!
It's time to get making! We're all going to check out the cool space.
We're feeling crafty! Come join us at the maker space!
This invite's no fake, we're going to make!
A community space for making of all kinds, where neighbors can gather to craft and recycle goods, or dabble in activities like candle-making, juice fizzing, fabricate, or painting!
We're going to get together and do some shopping and want you to join us!
Want to browse some local wares as a group?
To market! To market! Get a move on, jiggity jog.
Let's be good neighbors and visit the community space. Come along!
We're going to check out the local community space! Are you in?
A space full of possibility for use by the local community. Work together as community desires change to make the space fit what residents want!
Looking for a place to practice growing and cultivating? The Community Garden is the perfect place for neighbors to plant together!
A community market where crafters and makers can sell their wares and shoppers can browse them.

What was once a bustling trade port now holds a number of homes and businesses that pay homage to their industrial roots and aim to, as the local expression goes, "Keep Evergreen Kooky!" While the actual port may no longer be running, the promise of something better remains.

What happens when the trains stop running? Downtown Evergreen, affectionately known to locals as Conifer Station, may be a bit quieter nowadays, but residents will tell you that the defunct train station and unsightly storage tanks hide a hard-working community eager to improve their little corner of the world.

When prospector Arnold Grims founded his famous rock quarry in Evergreen Harbor, he could hardly have predicted the little suburb that would spring up around it decades later. Today, a cozy set of homes, apartments, and spaces for community use sits in the shadow of the walls of striking white stone.
